net.sf.gogui.go
Class GoPoint

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.gogui.go.GoPoint
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<GoPoint>
public final class GoPoint
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<GoPoint>

Intersection on the Go board. This class is immutable and references to the same point are unique. Instances can be created with GoPoint.get(). Point coordinates start with 0, the point (0,0) corresponds to "A1" and is on the lower left corner of the board, if the board is drawn on the screen.

Field Detail

MAX_SIZE

public static final int MAX_SIZE
Maximum board size. Set such that all points can be converted to strings with one letter and a number, i.e. the largest point is Z25.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final int DEFAULT_SIZE
Default board size.

Method Detail

compareTo

public int compareTo(GoPoint p)
Compare two points. The order of the points is: A1, B1, ..., A2, B2, ...

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<GoPoint>

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Indicate if this object is equal to another object. Since point instances are unique, this function does the same as Object.equals and is only added explicitely to avoid warnings about classes with a compareTo, but no equals-function.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object

equals

public static boolean equals(GoPoint point1,
                             GoPoint point2)
Compare, including the case that the points can be null.

get

public static GoPoint get(int x,
                          int y)
Factory method for creating a point.

Parameters:
x - x-coordinate [0...GoPoint.MAX_SIZE - 1]
y - y-coordinate [0...GoPoint.MAX_SIZE - 1]
Returns:
Unique reference to a point with these coordinates.

getIndex

public int getIndex()
Integer for using points as indices in an array. The index of A1 is zero and the indices count upwards from left to right and bottom to top over a board with the maximum size GoPoint.MAX_SIZE.

getIndex

public static int getIndex(int x,
                           int y)
See getIndex().

parsePoint

public static GoPoint parsePoint(java.lang.String string,
                                 int boardSize)
                          throws InvalidPointException
Parse point or null (PASS). Parsing is case-insensitive, leading and trailing whitespace is ignored. "PASS" returns null, invalid strings throw an InvalidPointException.

Throws:
InvalidPointException

right

public GoPoint right(int max)
Return point right.

Parameters:
max - Current board size.
Returns:
The point to the right of this point (x, y + 1) or this point if no such point exists.

public static java.lang.String toString(GoPoint point)
Convert a point or null point (pass) to a string.

toString

public static java.lang.String toString(ConstPointList pointList)
Convert a list of points to a string. Points are separated by a single space. If pointList is null, "(null)" is returned.

up

public GoPoint up(int max)
Return point above.

Parameters:
max - Current board size.
Returns:
The point above this point (x, y + 1) or this point if no such point exists.
